RainbruRPG::Core::GameEngine

RainbruRPG::Core::GameEngine Class Reference

List of all members.

Detailed Description

The game engine.

This singleton deals with some GameState and with options

The options are stored in the data/saves/options.xml file. They are read by an instance of the XmlOptions class, created in the void init() method.

To run game, make sure you have called GameEngine::play() before calling GameEngine::run().

To quit the application from the launcher, the quit button callback does not call play(). m_running is not set to true and when we call run(), we do not enter in the main loop.

Definition at line 107 of file gameengine.h.

Member Function Documentation

void RainbruRPG::Core::GameEngine::init (  ) 

Initialize the GameEngine instance.

This method must be called once. It loads the options with a XmlOptions class instance.

It only initialize Irrlicht engine. Each GameState initialize its own parameters.

Definition at line 69 of file gameengine.cpp.

void RainbruRPG::Core::GameEngine::run (  ) 

Enter in the Ogre mainloop.

This call must follow a call to play() if you want to enter in the mainloop.

See also:
play(), m_running

A function used to know if the GameEngine is running.

Returns:
the value of the m_running variable

Definition at line 57 of file gameengine.cpp.

void RainbruRPG::Core::GameEngine::play (  ) 

Set m_running to true telling GameEngine it can run.

This call is needed as it sets m_running to true. If m_running is set to false, run() does not enter in the main loop.

See also:
run(), m_running

Definition at line 87 of file gameengine.cpp.

void RainbruRPG::Core::GameEngine::quit (  ) 

Set m_running to false so the run method do nothing.

It can be called even before the init or run methods The m_running value is tested by the GuiFrameListener for earch frame and if the GameEngine is not still running, it request the shutdown of the engine.

caution : The Ogre RenderWindow must exist.

Definition at line 792 of file gameengine.cpp.

bool RainbruRPG::Core::GameEngine::connectUser ( const char *  user,
const char *  pwd 
)

Test if the given User can be connected.

The values are entered by the user in the gsConnection gamestate. There are send to a ClientConnect instance to test connection rights.

Parameters:
user The userName
pwd The password hashsum of the given user
Returns:
true if the connection is accepted otherwise returns false.

void RainbruRPG::Core::GameEngine::setupResources (  )  [private]

Setup the ressources needed from the file .

./config/resources.cfg

Member Data Documentation

vector<GameState*> RainbruRPG::Core::GameEngine::states [private]

The stack of states.

All the GameStates the GameEngine can use are in this STL vector. We know wich state we use with the actualState integer.

Definition at line 186 of file gameengine.h.

int RainbruRPG::Core::GameEngine::actualState [private]

The index of the in-use State.

We know wich state we use in the states vector with this integer.

bool RainbruRPG::Core::GameEngine::m_running [private]

Tells the GameEngine if it runs.

The play() and quit() methods assign true and false to this boolean.
